abstract.t: The Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) is an application layercontrol (signaling) protocol for creating, modifying and terminatingsessions with one or more participants. In the current PSTN, callsignaling messages travel through switches which act as trustedintermediaries. The signaling messages typically include callingparty identification information which may be delivered to thecalled party. The calling party is able to suppress the delivery ofsuch information to the called party in order to maintain privacy.
